articles.headline: The Reintroduction of Kamala Harris
articles.snippet: Vice President Kamala Harris has spent the past year trying to quiet her doubters. Now, with President Biden’s candidacy on the line, Democrats are assessing whether she is up to being the nominee.
articles.abstract: Vice President Kamala Harris has spent the past year trying to quiet her doubters. Now, with President Biden’s candidacy on the line, Democrats are assessing whether she is up to being the nominee.
articles.lead_paragraph: By early this year, around the time a prosecutor called President Biden a “well-meaning, elderly man with a poor memory,” Vice President Kamala Harris already knew something had to change.

articles.headline: Labour Won a U.K. Landslide. Why Doesn’t It Feel Like That?
articles.snippet: Keir Starmer’s party won a huge majority in parliament. But the new prime minister faces a fractious and volatile public.
articles.abstract: Keir Starmer’s party won a huge majority in parliament. But the new prime minister faces a fractious and volatile public.
articles.lead_paragraph: Britain’s voters handed the Labour Party a landslide election victory this week, but one laden with asterisks.

articles.headline: Reformist Candidate Wins Iran’s Presidential Election
articles.snippet: Masoud Pezeshkian, a cardiac surgeon and relative moderate in the ruling establishment, defeated an ultraconservative former nuclear negotiator in a runoff.
articles.abstract: Masoud Pezeshkian, a cardiac surgeon and relative moderate in the ruling establishment, defeated an ultraconservative former nuclear negotiator in a runoff.
articles.lead_paragraph: In an election upset in Iran, the reformist candidate who advocated moderate policies at home and improved relations with the West won the presidential runoff against a hard-line rival, according to results released by the interior ministry on Saturday.

articles.headline: In Ukraine, Killings of Surrendering Russians Divide an American-Led Unit
articles.snippet: A German medic said he was so troubled that he confronted his commander. Others boasted about killings in a group chat.
articles.abstract: A German medic said he was so troubled that he confronted his commander. Others boasted about killings in a group chat.
articles.lead_paragraph: Hours after a battle in eastern Ukraine in August, a wounded and unarmed Russian soldier crawled through a nearly destroyed trench, seeking help from his captors, a unit of international volunteers led by an American.

articles.headline: Inside the Factory Turning Trash Into Olympic Podiums
articles.snippet: To help make the Olympic Games in Paris greener, Le Pavé, a manufacturing start-up, is making podiums and stadium seating out of recycled plastic.
articles.abstract: To help make the Olympic Games in Paris greener, Le Pavé, a manufacturing start-up, is making podiums and stadium seating out of recycled plastic.
articles.lead_paragraph: The world’s best athletes will receive their gold medals at the Paris Olympic and Paralympic Games this summer while standing on trash. Recycled food containers, to be exact.

articles.headline: Can Foreigners Handle the Heat? Mexico City Debates Milder Salsas.
articles.snippet: As more foreigners, especially Americans, visit or move to Mexico City, some taco shops have lowered the heat in their sauces. Not everyone is happy.
articles.abstract: As more foreigners, especially Americans, visit or move to Mexico City, some taco shops have lowered the heat in their sauces. Not everyone is happy.
articles.lead_paragraph: Gerardo Medina runs the Taquería Los Amigos, a 24-hour stand that sits at a busy intersection in an upscale neighborhood in Mexico City.
articles.byline: By James Wagner and Luis Antonio Rojas

articles.headline: Crisis? What Crisis? Biden Rejects Democratic Pessimism.
articles.snippet: After last week’s devastating debate performance, the president’s prime-time interview with ABC News was an exercise in not just damage control but reality control.
articles.abstract: After last week’s devastating debate performance, the president’s prime-time interview with ABC News was an exercise in not just damage control but reality control.
articles.lead_paragraph: All sounds fine in President Biden’s world. That devastating debate? Just a bad night. Those dismal poll numbers? Simply inaccurate. The gloomy election predictions? The same old doomsayers, wrong again. The Democrats who want him to drop out? No one has told him that.

articles.headline: Two Young Drivers Take the Wheel. One, a Teen. The Other, a Tesla.
articles.snippet: Can my son learn from the example of the robot controlling the steering wheel? Or should it be the other way around?
articles.abstract: Can my son learn from the example of the robot controlling the steering wheel? Or should it be the other way around?
articles.lead_paragraph: At the corner of Iris Ave and Folsom in North Boulder, my Model 3 Tesla was self-driving when it showed up two human drivers in the lane just in front of us. All three of us were turning left — two flesh-and-blood drivers and my robot — when the two humans violated a basic traffic rule by swinging wide and turning into the right hand lane.

articles.headline: Students Target Teachers in Group TikTok Attack, Shaking Their School
articles.snippet: Seventh and eighth graders in Malvern, Pa., impersonating their teachers posted disparaging, lewd, racist and homophobic videos in the first known mass attack of its kind in the U.S.
articles.abstract: Seventh and eighth graders in Malvern, Pa., impersonating their teachers posted disparaging, lewd, racist and homophobic videos in the first known mass attack of its kind in the U.S.
articles.lead_paragraph: In February, Patrice Motz, a veteran Spanish teacher at Great Valley Middle School in Malvern, Pa., was warned by another teacher that trouble was brewing.

articles.headline: New Plan to Target Russia’s Oil Revenue Brings Debate in White House
articles.snippet: Treasury officials want to impose penalties on tankers that help Russian oil evade sanctions. White House aides worry that risks making gasoline more expensive.
articles.abstract: Treasury officials want to impose penalties on tankers that help Russian oil evade sanctions. White House aides worry that risks making gasoline more expensive.
articles.lead_paragraph: Officials in President Biden’s Treasury Department have proposed new actions aimed at crippling a fleet of aging oil tankers that are helping deliver Russian oil to buyers around the world in defiance of Western sanctions.
articles.byline: By Jim Tankersley and Alan Rappeport

articles.headline: For Some Young Couples, Saving on Rent Means Moving In Together Early
articles.snippet: Citing high housing costs, some couples are sharing apartments after dating for just a short period. Not all relationships survive.
articles.abstract: Citing high housing costs, some couples are sharing apartments after dating for just a short period. Not all relationships survive.
articles.lead_paragraph: For Caroline Li and Colin Wang, moving in together after dating for eight months was a matter of serendipity and urgency.

articles.headline: In Rafah, We Saw Destruction and the Limits of Israel’s Gaza Strategy
articles.snippet: Months after Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu declared that “victory is within reach,” the Israeli military escorted journalists into parts of a devastated Gazan city.
articles.abstract: Months after Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu declared that “victory is within reach,” the Israeli military escorted journalists into parts of a devastated Gazan city.
articles.lead_paragraph: The armed convoy of jeeps filled with reporters rumbled into a dusty Rafah, passing flattened houses and battered apartment buildings.

articles.headline: After 9 Months of War, Israelis Call for a Cease-Fire Deal and Elections
articles.snippet: A day of nationwide anti-government protests comes amid signs of progress toward a truce and hostage deal with Hamas, as well as continued fighting.
articles.abstract: A day of nationwide anti-government protests comes amid signs of progress toward a truce and hostage deal with Hamas, as well as continued fighting.
articles.lead_paragraph: Israelis on Sunday marked nine months since the devastating Hamas-led attack of Oct. 7 and the start of the ensuing war in Gaza with a nationwide day of anti-government protests at a time that many here view as a pivotal juncture in the conflict.

articles.headline: Wildlife Protections Take a Back Seat to SpaceX’s Ambitions
articles.snippet: A New York Times investigation found that Elon Musk exploited federal agencies’ competing missions to achieve his goals for space travel.
articles.abstract: A New York Times investigation found that Elon Musk exploited federal agencies’ competing missions to achieve his goals for space travel.
articles.lead_paragraph: As Elon Musk’s Starship — the largest rocket ever manufactured — successfully blasted toward the sky last month, the launch was hailed as a giant leap for SpaceX and the United States’ civilian space program.
articles.byline: By Eric Lipton and Meridith Kohut

articles.headline: Top House Democrats Privately Say Biden Must Go as Allies Insist He Must Do More
articles.snippet: During a private meeting of top House Democrats, several senior lawmakers said it was time for President Biden to withdraw, while a Senate Democrat said publicly he must do more to reassure voters.
articles.abstract: During a private meeting of top House Democrats, several senior lawmakers said it was time for President Biden to withdraw, while a Senate Democrat said publicly he must do more to reassure voters.
articles.lead_paragraph: President Biden’s base of support among key Democrats on Capitol Hill began to crumble on Sunday as a half-dozen top members of the House privately told colleagues he should withdraw from the presidential race amid growing concerns about his age and ability to win re-election.
articles.byline: By Luke Broadwater, Robert Jimison and Annie Karni

articles.headline: French Election Yields Deadlock as Left Surges and Far Right Comes Up Short
articles.snippet: The outcome left no party with an absolute majority and France bracing for potential political paralysis.
articles.abstract: The outcome left no party with an absolute majority and France bracing for potential political paralysis.
articles.lead_paragraph: France faced a hung parliament and deep political uncertainty after the three main political groups of the left, center and right emerged from snap legislative elections on Sunday with large shares of the vote but nothing approaching an absolute majority.

articles.headline: Meet David Ellison, Paramount’s Future Boss and Hollywood’s Newest Mogul
articles.snippet: He left college to try out acting. Now, he’s set to become one of the most powerful people in Hollywood.
articles.abstract: He left college to try out acting. Now, he’s set to become one of the most powerful people in Hollywood.
articles.lead_paragraph: David Ellison’s Hollywood career has been defined by high-octane blockbusters filled with suspense, stunts and improbable plot twists.

articles.headline: The Yen Is Plunging. So Is Japan’s Defense Budget.
articles.snippet: Japan is struggling to fund plans that would significantly bolster its military readiness amid rising regional threats.
articles.abstract: Japan is struggling to fund plans that would significantly bolster its military readiness amid rising regional threats.
articles.lead_paragraph: The yen’s collapse this year to a nearly four-decade low is undermining Japan’s plans for its largest military buildup in postwar history.
articles.byline: By River Akira Davis and Hisako Ueno

articles.headline: Boeing Agrees to Plead Guilty to Felony in Deal With Justice Department
articles.snippet: As part of the deal, stemming from fatal 737 Max crashes in 2018 and 2019, the company agreed to pay a fine of nearly half a billion dollars and strengthen its safety programs.
articles.abstract: As part of the deal, stemming from fatal 737 Max crashes in 2018 and 2019, the company agreed to pay a fine of nearly half a billion dollars and strengthen its safety programs.
articles.lead_paragraph: Boeing agreed on Sunday to plead guilty to a felony charge of conspiring to defraud the federal government over two fatal crashes of the 737 Max in 2018 and 2019, according to a late-night court filing.
articles.byline: By Eileen Sullivan and Danielle Kaye

articles.headline: Russia Strikes Children’s Hospital in Deadly Barrage Across Ukraine
articles.snippet: President Volodymyr Zelensky said Russia launched at least 40 missiles at targets across Ukraine, including the country’s largest children’s hospital.
articles.abstract: President Volodymyr Zelensky said Russia launched at least 40 missiles at targets across Ukraine, including the country’s largest children’s hospital.
articles.lead_paragraph: Ukraine’s largest children’s hospital was destroyed by a Russian missile on Monday, shaking Kyiv, the capital, with images of bloodied and injured children, and sending hundreds racing to the scene to help clear twisted metal and smashed concrete in a desperate search for survivors.
articles.byline: By Marc Santora and Brendan Hoffman

articles.headline: Biden Says He Is ‘Firmly Committed’ to Staying in the Race
articles.snippet: President Biden defied his critics in a letter to Democratic members of Congress and in fiery remarks on MSNBC.
articles.abstract: President Biden defied his critics in a letter to Democratic members of Congress and in fiery remarks on MSNBC.
articles.lead_paragraph: President Biden on Monday dared his critics to “challenge me at the convention” if they want him out of the presidential race, refusing to step aside in a defiant letter to Democratic members of Congress and in fiery remarks on MSNBC’s “Morning Joe” program.

articles.headline: U.S. Creates High-Tech Global Supply Chains to Blunt Risks Tied to China
articles.snippet: The Biden administration is trying to get foreign companies to invest in chip-making in the United States and more countries to set up factories to do final assembly and packaging.
articles.abstract: The Biden administration is trying to get foreign companies to invest in chip-making in the United States and more countries to set up factories to do final assembly and packaging.
articles.lead_paragraph: If the Biden administration had its way, far more electronic chips would be made in factories in, say, Texas or Arizona.
articles.byline: By Edward Wong and Ana Swanson

articles.headline: Justice Amy Coney Barrett’s Independent Streak Marked Supreme Court Term
articles.snippet: The junior member of the court’s six-justice conservative supermajority often questioned its approach and wrote important dissents joined by liberal justices.
articles.abstract: The junior member of the court’s six-justice conservative supermajority often questioned its approach and wrote important dissents joined by liberal justices.
articles.lead_paragraph: Justice Amy Coney Barrett, 52, is the youngest member of the Supreme Court and the junior member of its conservative supermajority. Last week, she completed what was only her third full term.

articles.headline: A Wall Street Law Firm Wants to Define Consequences of Israel Protests
articles.snippet: Sullivan & Cromwell is requiring job applicants to explain their participation in protests. Critics see the policy as a way to silence speech about the war.
articles.abstract: Sullivan & Cromwell is requiring job applicants to explain their participation in protests. Critics see the policy as a way to silence speech about the war.
articles.lead_paragraph: For as long as students at colleges across the United States have protested the war in Gaza, they’ve drawn the fury of some of the financial world’s mightiest figures — investors, lawyers and bankers — who have flexed their financial power over universities, toppling school leaders in the process.

articles.headline: Following Trump’s Lead, Republicans Adopt Platform That Softens Stance on Abortion
articles.snippet: The document reflects the former president’s ideological grip on his party, outlining the same nationalistic priorities that his campaign website does.
articles.abstract: The document reflects the former president’s ideological grip on his party, outlining the same nationalistic priorities that his campaign website does.
articles.lead_paragraph: Donald J. Trump told officials on Monday that he supports a new Republican Party platform, one that reflects the presumptive nominee’s new position on abortion rights and slims down policy specifics across all areas of government.
articles.byline: By Maggie Haberman, Shane Goldmacher and Jonathan Swan
